Key Match Events: Philadelphia's one-time MVP scorched Brooklyn for 17 points in the game's opening 24 minutes
Brooklyn's lead was 11-0 initially, but Philadelphia responded with a 9-0 run
Philadelphia's lead ballooned up to 31 points at halftime
D'Angelo Russell missed the rest of the game with a right shin contusion
Pre-Game Insights: Brooklyn was without three pivotal pieces - Cam Thomas, Cam Johnson, and Ben Simmons - due to injury
Joel Embiid was listed as active
Jordi Fernandez had to dig deep into his bench due to the injury situation
Tosan Evbuomwan made his NBA debut and scored 39 points for the Long Island Nets in a game before the match
Reece Beekman, acquired from Golden State, made his first official NBA appearance
Post-Match Reflections: The Nets' falter can be summed up in three simple stats: 22 turnovers, 32 points conceded off those miscues, and 34.1% shooting from beyond the arc
Brooklyn did not record a single scorer over the 20-point threshold
A fully healthy squad likely makes this one much closer
Miscellaneous Highlights: Brooklyn announced on X that Russell would miss the remainder of the contest with a right shin contusion
The Nets are now 13-22 on the season
